key_findings: The paper proposes a Thinking-While-Grounding Reinforced Policy Optimization (TW-GRPO) method that aims to improve video reasoning by focusing the model's thinking process on semantically critical spatio-temporal cues in the video.
TW-GRPO achieves state-of-the-art performance on several video reasoning benchmarks, including 50.4% accuracy on CLEVRER (18.8% improvement over Video-R1) and 65.8% on MMVU.
The method addresses the issue of verbose and unfocused thinking chains produced by existing chain-of-thought reasoning approaches when applied to multimodal language-video models.
TW-GRPO uses soft reward signals based on video grounding, which enables learning from partial correctness instead of relying on sparse, binary rewards from single-choice question-answering tasks.
The approach prioritizes semantically critical spatio-temporal cues in the video, which can improve learning efficiency and reasoning quality for complex multimodal tasks.
